alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Franklin County through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Highgate, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enosburg Falls, Franklin, Highgate, Enosburg Falls Village, Berkshire, Lake Carmi State Park, Richford, Enosburg, Montgomery, Sheldon, Phelps Bay, Rock River Bay, East Berkshire, West Berkshire, East Franklin, Highgate Springs, South Franklin, Limekiln Point, North Enosburg and South Richford. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 128 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northwestern Vermont.
